page.title: 01Kiloran & Cliffs Colonsay
page.content: This area has two distinctly contrasting types of land and the land use. On the western coast of the island rise the steep rugged cliffs of Uragaig Pensinsula and "Pigs Paradise"; the formers shoreline riddled with caves the latters cliffs covered in spring with seabirds nests. The land immediatly inland of thisd and surrounding the reservoir is roughly grazed by blackface sheep and some cattle. Ground cover is mostly heather & rough grass. To the SE the lowlying land is a well protected inland area of pasture, arable and planted woodland, which is not worked at present, the microclimate created by warm tempretures and protection from the wind provides for a garden of exotic trees & shrubs particularly early flowering Rhodedendrons and Azaleas. Here is the home farm,
